title: Sous Vide Duck Breast
full_text:
Sous Vide Duck Breast

60 mins

15 mins

5 mins

13 hrs 15 mins
Serves
4 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
4
boneless duck breasts
(about
5 to 6 ounces
each;
150
-
175
g
)
Kosher salt
and
freshly cracked black pepper
Directions
Season duck generously with salt and pepper. For best results, place on a plate and refrigerate uncovered overnight before proceeding.
Seal duck in vacuum bags. Place in 130°F (54°C) water bath for at least 45 minutes and up to 4 hours. Remove from bags and dry thoroughly with paper towels.
Place breasts skin side-down in a heavy-bottomed 12-inch non-stick or cast iron skillet and set over high heat until sizzling, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and cook, moving and pressing breasts to ensure good contact between skin and pan until golden brown and crisp, about 5 minutes. Flip and cook second side until barely colored, about 30 seconds. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate and allow to rest for 5 minutes.
Slice breasts crosswise into 1/2-inch strips and serve.
Special Equipment
Sous vide circulator
